choices.b: People with a BMI ≥35 with type II diabetes
choices.c: People with a BMI of 30-34.9 with onset of type II diabetes within 10 years

question: Adult female patient presented with long standing dysphagia to liquids more than solids, she did esophageal endoscopic dilation twice but the symptoms recurs again, the best option for here now is:

choices.b: Repeat the Dilation with a balloon

question: Old male patient, smoker, presented with tongue ulcer about 1X1 cm not responding to conservative treatment, the neck has hard submandibular lymph node, what is his stage if he was diagnosed to have tongue cancer?

Which of the following trace elements is important to be given in cases of diarrhea?
In a patient who has been infected with HAV, which of the following usually provides immunity against HAV for life?

choices.c: Normalization of AST and ALT levels

question: Patients with Hirschsprung disease most commonly present with a symptom early in life. Which of the following is the most prominent symptom or sign of the disease in neonates?

choices.a: Empty rectum on digital rectal examination
choices.b: Failure to pass meconium within 48 hours of life
choices.c: Lack of physiologic urge to defecate
choices.d: Mild constipation with intermittent bouts of mild diarrhea

question: Ankylostoma anemia is due to:

choices.b: Red cell hypoplasia in the bone marrow.
choices.c: Shortening of the red cell lifespan.

question: Which of the following approaches is most appropriate for rehydration in children with mild to moderate dehydration?

choices.a: Sports drinks in young children and adolescents
choices.c: Standard oral formulas in all but infants < 1 yr

question: Which one of the following represents the definition of remittent fever?

choices.a: Fever with fluctuation <1 °C and doesn't reach the baseline
choices.b: Fever with fluctuation > 1°C and reach the baseline
choices.c: Fever with fluctuation > 1° C and doesn't reach the baseline
choices.d: Days of fever and days of normal temperature

question: A 74-year-old male patient presented to the outpatient clinic with boring epigastric pain that is referred to the back of gradual onset and a progressive course. On examination, the temperature was 37.4 and jaundice. Laboratory investigations showed an ESR 1st hour of 105, total bilirubin 8.7mg/dl, direct bilirubin 6.6 mg/dl. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 23-year-old female presented to the emergency department with melena. She denies abdominal pain. Resting pulse was 102, blood pressure 100/55. Which is the first investigation required to reach the diagnosis?

A 75-year-old man with a 2-day history of abdominal pain and diarrhea after a course of clindamycin treatment for 1 week before the diarrhea started. Temperature was 38° C, and his abdomen was distended and diffusely tender. An abdominal X-ray showed toxic dilatation. Which of the following represents the most appropriate antimicrobial therapy?
A non-vaccinated laboratory worker accidentally exposed to a needle prick from a known hepatitis B surface antigen +ve patient. Which of the following should be given to this worker immediately?

A 22-year-old female complained of frontal headache and fever for ten days. On inquiry, she complained of anorexia, abdominal discomfort, and constipation. She had a dry cough and muscular aches. On examination, she looked ill, and her temperature was 40.5 C, pulse rate 92/min, blood pressure 120/70mmHg, respiratory rate 18/min. Scattered rhonchi were heard throughout lung fields. There was generalized abdominal tenderness; no rigidity or guarding. Spleen was palpated; there was no lymphadenopathy. Hemoglobin 11.0 gm; WBC 3500; blood film negative; ALT 15 IU/mL, AST 22 IU/mL, Total bilirubin 0.8 mg, urine analysis was negative. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 60-year-old woman comes to your office with a 5-year history of "constipation." You try to evaluate your patient to determine what is meant by "constipation." Which of the following is the best definition?

choices.a: Only one bowel movement in 3 days
choices.e: Fewer than three bowel movements in 7 days

question: A 70-year-old man comes to your office with a complaint of "constipation." The patient had ischemic heart disease and hypertension controlled on medication. On examination, the head and neck, the lungs, the cardiovascular system, and the abdomen are all normal. Digital rectal examination (DRE) reveals impacted stool. Which of the following drugs is most closely associated with constipation in the elderly?

A 55-year-old male patient comes to you with "heartburn" and nausea but no vomiting or diarrhea. He feels full quickly after eating. He has noticed that his stool looks darker than it used to but has not seen any blood. On examination, he is pale appearing. His blood pressure is 120/80 mm Hg, and his pulse is 95 beats/min. There is epigastric tenderness to palpation but no masses. An abdominal mass is palpated. Rectal examination reveals black stool. What is the most likely diagnosis?

choices.e: Increased risk of bleeding with propranolol
